ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Live virtual lectures 1-2 times per week, which were recorded, along with a total of seven live virtual seminar discussion sections.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: cell fate, and a bunch of other random experimental techniques (CHIA pet), noncoding regions, epigenetics, post transcriptional modifications

I learned about epigenetics, genetic analysis, heredity, population genetics, CRISPR and other methods of genetic manipulation, etc. I also gained skills and experience in reading and analyzing scientific literature and publications.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: 

Weaknesses: way too experimentally -focused for someone who's never worked in a wet lab before, no centralized source of info / material for the hw. I felt like each hw was a research project / lit review cause the lectures often were unrelated to the hw and there was no textbook

Strengths: diversity of topics covered, interesting content, effective course structure (several lectures to teach the content, followed by a discussion section to discuss a relevant academic paper)
Weaknesses: some lack of continuity/ organization due to the number of different topics and instructors for the course

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Overall, the course was well organized for the pandemic, as the lectures worked well over Zoom. Discussion sections were somewhat difficult to have virtually; as is the case with most STEM course discussion sections, sometimes a few voices are louder than others and certain students will speak up more, making it difficult for others to participate, which is only amplified when courses are held on Zoom. However, the teaching fellows made the discussion environment comfortable and were very helpful.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, an interesting way to learn genetics techniques
only take it if you're well versed in wet lab procedures, this class is all about experimentation and planning exps

I would recommend this course to another student interested in genetics, heredity, and genetic analysis. There was a lot of practical information taught in addition to theoretical, which was very helpful and engaging. However, the material does not really build from one week to the next, and there are no exams, so this is the type of course that requires you to be self-motivated if you want to get a lot out of it.
